acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Since LD50 value of the dermal administration test employing rats was 400-800 mg/kg (IUCLID (2000)), it was classified into Category 3.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: It is written that LC50 value of 4-hour inhalation exposure test employing rats is >0.16 mg/L (IUCLID (2000)). Although the dust standard was applied to this substance from saturated vapor pressure level with 0.013 mg/L (25degC), classification cannot be specified, and classification is not possible.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Since it was a solid by the definition of GHS and inhalation in gas was not assumed, it was classified into "Not applicable".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: From LD50 value of 400 mg/kg and 172 mg/kg (female)-175 mg/kg (male) (IUCLID (2000)) of the oral administration test employing a rat, the lower value was adopted and it was classified into Category 3.

aspiration_hazard.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification is not possible due to insufficiency of data, because evaluation by major international evaluation institutions has not been performed. Incidentally, there is a description as follows, "Tumors were not found in the skin or other tissues."(IUCLID (2000)) in the 104 week dermal administration test (GLP) using male and female mice.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_solids.rationale:
Since it was classified into  Class 6.1 and PG III in the United Nations Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods ((UN No.2811), it was classified into Not classified. 
In addition, this TDG classification is based on the UN number by Merck KGaA data from March 2009.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification is not possible because there is no data of in vivo examination. In addition, there is a description of "negative" in the in vitro reverse mutation test (mutations test employing a Salmonella typhimurium (GLP)) (IUCLID (2000)).

organic_peroxides.rationale: The organic compound not including peroxy group in molecule.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: It is an organic compound not containing oxygen, fluorine or chlorine.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Since it was classified into Class 6.1 and PG III in the United Nations Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods (UN No.2811). In addition, this TDG classification is based on the UN number by Merck KGaA data from March 2009.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Classification is not possible since there is no data.

self_heating_substances.rationale: The test method applicable for substances becoming liquid or gas at 140degC of test temperature has not been established.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Although there is a description, "not irritating" (IUCLID (2000)) for the 24 hour skin irritation test using rats in the information source of List 2, classification is not possible, because details are unknown nor other data available.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Although there is a description of "not sensitizing" in the skin sensitivity test employing guinea pig (IUCLID (2000)), classification is not possible because of no other data.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At) are not included.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (kidney)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In the document (J. Toxicol.Environ.Health.10 (1982)) cited from the 3-month oral administration test in male and female rats (IUCLID (2000)), there is the description that "concretion and kidney sclerosis (nephrosclerosis) were observed." Although effects on kidney were observed within the dosage in the Category 1 guidance value range, the substance is classified into Category 2 (kidney) according to this guidance because that is the data for List 2 and does not meet the criteria of 1 b3.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: According to the cited reference of IUCLID (2000) (J. Toxicol.Environ.Health.10 (1982)), there is a description that "with non-lethality dose (female: 100 mg/kg, male: 150 mg/kg), symptom and pathological findings change was not deemed but the deemed symptom was somnolence only in the oral administration test employing a rat. The fatality reaction curve of this substance is a steep slope, and the least fatal doses of female and male rats are 130 mg/kg and 160 mg/kg, respectively. Dead animals have lung hemorrhage, lung dropsy, intra-alveolar bleeding, atelectatic lung, and the congestion was also regarded in lungs, the kidney, and the lien. Moreover, taking into consideration the fact that agricultural-chemicals paraquat which is the dimethyl compound of this substance characteristically damage lungs, it is presumed that this substance's target internal organs are also lungs. In addition, although such symptom was equivalent to Category 1 by judging from the guidance value, it was classified into Category 2 (pneumoconiosiss) according to this guidance because it was data of List2, and doesn't meet the acceptance criteria 1b 3).
